author: Special Correspondent
text:
A group of volunteers who are on a Chennai – Coimbatore – Kanyakumari bicycle expedition to create awareness on the importance of protecting water bodies, and other natural resources arrived here on Friday.

The expedition, “Ride for Right to Live,” was flagged off from Chennai on February 6.

The objective of the expedition is to create an awareness among the common people, particularly the rural masses, and the student community, on the need to protect all the natural resources such as water, minerals, sand, trees, and soil, which are under severe threat due to wrong policies and mismanagement, should be protected at all cost.

They complained that many natural resources are depleting due to illicit mining etc by unscrupulous elements. The government has also turned a blind eye to these illegal and clandestine activities.

They demanded the government to introduce a police and introduce legislation to save these natural resources at any cost. The policy should he so framed that the local people are effectively involved in resource protection.

The volunteers visited a private school and a couple of government schools and interacted with the students. They also visited a few villages abutting the city.

They inspected the Mookanery lake in the city, which was renovated by the volunteers of the Salem Citizens Forum. Piyus Sethia, Coordinator of the Forum, explained the steps taken for the proper maintenance of the lake.

Later the expedition members left for Namakkal in the evening.

The volunteers are expected to reach Kanyakumari after three weeks.

The aim is to create an awareness among citizens about the need to protect water bodies
title: Cycle expedition reaches Salem
